timeline.bodyText: Do we know when the error is available in salt/errormessages.yaml and salt/stderrcommands.yaml files?
timeline.author: kkalvagadda1

replies.bodyText: I'm not sure I understand the question. In errormessages.yaml, the code is basically replacing any errors run by the listed processes with the error in the YAML file. In stderrcommands.yaml we're just listing some processes, and the error comes from the stderr output. If the stderr output doesn't exist, then it defaults to a message that just says, "Failed to execute: "
replies.author: hreeve-cloudera

timeline.message:
CB-7729 Retrieve errors from Data Lake Database backup/restore failures

Pulls the status reason for failed database backup/restore operations from the
salt stderr ouput, instead of from the command comment. The is achieved by
adding a new YAML file used by SaltErrorResolver, stderrcommands.yaml. When a
command listed in that file is run, the stderr output will be used as the
resolved error message. The getErrorResultSummary() method in RunnerInfo now
returns the summary in map form for simpler parsing in SaltErrorResolver.

Tested with unit tests and by testing in my local cloudbreak dev environment.
